meanings.definition: Fracks (verb): to extract oil or gas by injecting liquid at high pressure into subterranean rocks
meanings.sent1: The company fracks the rocks to get oil and gas.
meanings.sent2: Workers fracks the underground rocks to extract natural resources.
meanings.sent3: Why did the geologist bring a cake to the fracking site? To celebrate the successful fracks!
meanings.sent4: The pressure used in fracking fracks the rocks like a powerful hammer.
meanings.sent5: The sound of fracks echoes through the earth as the oil is released.

meanings.definition: Fracks (noun): a method of extracting oil or gas by injecting liquid at high pressure into subterranean rocks
meanings.sent1: The fracks in this region have led to increased oil production.
meanings.sent2: Many companies use fracks to access underground resources.
meanings.sent3: The fracks in the ground seemed to dance as the liquid was injected.
meanings.sent4: The fracks in the rocks resemble tiny pathways for the oil to flow.
meanings.sent5: The environmental impact of fracks is a topic of ongoing debate.
